title: What FPS would this build get me in LoL when i'm running it at max settings
body:
Hello Everybody! I've got a list of parts and was wondering if someone could tell me what fps this would get me on League of Legends at max settings.
There's other parts but i'm pretty sure these are the main ones.
Intel i7 4770
MSI GeForce GTX 980
ASUS Z97 Pro Gaming Motherboard
Corsair (2x4gb) Ram 1866mhz

replies.body: OVERKILL! Even with the ASUS Swift, the monitor won't be able to keep up! If you do buy this, PLEASE get an ASUS ROG Swift (and enable G-SYNC). Smooth would be an understatement. Also you don't need any more than 1600Mhz RAM.
The monitors are over $600. No way.
Your build is way more expensive. I assumed it was in your price range.

that will demolish LoL, I get get 50 FPS on my crappy laptop with integrated graphics.

If you are going to have such a good cpu, good gpu, etc, you might as well get 16gb of ram, because by the time you want to upgrade ram, it could be difficult to find the same compatibility.

While yes, this is true as DDR3 will become less common, 16GB is still useless in every way if you don't do real multitasking (such as rendering 3 video files at once) The time when video games start using more than 4GB of RAM would be in 10 or so years. By then OP would probably have a better computer.

What would be even smarter is going for a motherboard and CPU that supports DDR4.
ram barely affects your performance so for gaming wise there is no need for anything more then 8gb

In all honesty that setup - overkill if you are only playing league.
You'll be hitting 200+fps with that, which is way overkill especially since I imagine your monitor is only 60hz...

if you play other games like Dragon Age: Inquisition or Battlefield 4 or something that requires more rendering power, then that build will also suffice for those games as well.

I have a 120hz monitor XD

edit:
and i'm not going to just be playing LoL, i'll be playing other games such as shadow of mordor (if i spelt it right) etc
60 fps easy. ( If you cap it at that, that is)

LoL doesn't use much resources because it's so well optimized, that should run it pretty damn well.

Source:My own regular laptop runs it at 50 fps on max settings so a gaming pc should run it really well
